attributes.action: recommend a UK Honour for the British actress Anita Dobson - which, after 37 years service in the entertainment industry is long overdue
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Anita Dobson - Services as an Actress. Although Anita Dobson will always be remembered for her role as Angie Watts from 1985 - 1988 in the BBC1 drama series 'EastEnders'she
is one of the UK's top theatrical actresses having appeared in many West End stage productions ranging from Shakespeare to comedy, musicals - one being in 2008 taking the lead role as Dolly Levi in Hello, Dolly! for 8 months which toured the UK,opera,hard hitting stage plays, one being 'Frozen' which won her much critical acclaim and nominated for an Olivier award.Anita will from 28 July for 3 months will be taking the lead in the much acclaimed play,the 'Calendar Girls'in London's WestEnd.
 For her charity work, Anita is vice president to the Royal London Society for the Blind and is patron to many theatrical schools, including LIPA and Stage 84 where she takes a keen interest in helping and encouraging young students to achieve their goal.
Anita is one of the most kindest, caring,helpful, compassionate human beings there is in this world.
  And it would be fitting for Anita to be considered for a UK National Honour for her services as an actress in the last 37 years.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
